events.event_name: Bank of England February Policy Meeting
events.description: The Bank of England kept its Bank Rate unchanged at 3.75% in February with a 5 to 4 vote.

facts.fact_text: The Bank of England maintained the Bank Rate at 3.75% in February.

evidences.evidence_text: The Bank of England kept its Bank Rate unchanged at 3.75% in February

facts.fact_text: The interest rate decision was reached by a 5 to 4 vote.
The Bank Rate has been cut by 150 basis points since August 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: Bank Rate has already been reduced by 150 basis points since August 2024

claims.claim_text: Inflation is expected to return to the 2% target starting in April.
claims.author: Bank of England policymakers

evidences.evidence_text: Inflation remains above the 2% target but is expected to fall back to around that level from April

claims.claim_text: Additional interest rate cuts are probable in the future.
claims.author: Monetary Policy Committee

evidences.evidence_text: The committee signalled that further rate cuts are likely but will depend on incoming inflation data

claims.claim_text: The danger of long-term persistent inflation has decreased.
claims.author: Policymakers

evidences.evidence_text: Policymakers noted that risks of persistent inflation have diminished

evidence.evidence_text: expected to fall back to around that level from April due partly to energy price developments
Pay growth and services inflation have continued to ease, reflecting subdued economic growth and rising slack in the labour market
weaker demand and a softening jobs market pose downside risks
